titles.title: To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the Federal minimum wage by $1.62 over 3 years.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 6/28/2001--Introduced. Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the Federal minimum wage (currently $5.15 per hour) to: (1) $5.65 per hour beginning on the effective date of this Act; (2) $6.15 per hour beginning one year after the effective date of this Act; and (3) $6.77 per hour beginning two years after the effective date of this Act.
